name: Network Error Control
description: Sector template for network error control patents including FEC, ARQ, and reliability mechanisms.
contextDescription: Network error control patents cover reliability and error correction. Key areas include forward error correction (FEC), automatic repeat request (ARQ), checksums, and link-layer retransmission. High-value targets include all networking vendors, storage systems, and high-reliability applications. FEC is essential for high-speed links and wireless.
scoringGuidance: FEC patents (LDPC, Reed-Solomon, polar codes) are essential for modern links.
ARQ/HARQ patents target wireless and unreliable links.
Interleaving patents improve burst error resilience.
Soft-decision decoding patents improve coding gain.
Application-layer FEC targets streaming and real-time video.

questions.question: What error control mechanism does this cover (FEC, ARQ, CRC, interleaving)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the error control mechanism and its applications.

questions.question: If FEC, what coding family (LDPC, turbo, polar, Reed-Solomon, convolutional)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Modern codes (LDPC, polar) are in 5G and high-speed links.

questions.question: What applications benefit (wireless, optical, storage, streaming)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Broader application scope increases patent value.
